text:
Flatbush Avenue, at the S. E. corner of Hanson Place (left), showing the Long Island Railroad Depot. The views are south and show the B. M. T. elevated structure on Flatbush Avenue.

View 1: May 11, 1929
View 2: June 15, 1940

P. L. Sperr

Flatbush Avenue, at the S. E. corner of Hanson Place (left), showing the Long Island Railroad Depot. The views are south and show the B. M. T. elevated structure on Flatbush Avenue.

View 1: May 11, 1929
View 2: June 15, 1940

P. L. Sperr

Hanson Place, north side, east from Flatbush Ave. In the foreground, (overhead), is the Fulton Elevated Line of the B.M.T., on Flatbush Ave. At the right, is the Long Island R.R. Terminal. At the left, is the Hanson Place M.E. Church.

May 11, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.
